** Chinese tech stocks facing increased regulatory scrutiny and the delisting plans of Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Global DIDI.N from the NYSE has led investors to rotate away from Chinese tech into U.S. tech stocks - Wedbush Securities

** Brokerage says, this creates a "nirvana set up" for FAANG stocks – Meta Platforms FB.O, Apple Inc AAPL.O, Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, Netflix NFLX.O and Alphabet GOOGL.O – and the U.S. tech sector into 2022

** Fear of more regulation is a major unknown variable for investors and continues to be a deterrent around owning Chinese tech stocks - Wedbush

** U.S.-listed Chinese tech giants including Alibaba BABA.N, Baidu BIDU.O and JD.Com JD.O have declined between ~12% to 46% YTD, while FB, GOOGL, AAPL, AMZN, NFLX and Microsoft MSFT.O have risen between ~8% and 68% so far this year

** "Our bullish view is U.S. tech stocks will be up another 20% for 2022 with our NASDAQ 19K target" says the brokerage

** Brokerage names Apple and Microsoft as its top tech picks going into 2022


(Reporting by Chavi Mehta in Bengaluru)
